qas.question: Where did Russian get specialized vocabulary from?
What second language was common among Russian nobles by 1800?
What third language was common among Russian nobles by 1800?
What language often appeared in Russian novels without translation?
In what year did Peter the Great come to power?
What did Peter the Great write in 1800?
What was Peter the Great's goal for writing War and Peace?
How many Germans immigrated to France in 1800?
What did Tolstoy write to reform Germany?

context: The political reforms of Peter the Great (Пётр Вели́кий, Pyótr Velíkiy) were accompanied by a reform of the alphabet, and achieved their goal of <b7_0>secularization and Westernization<b7_0/>. Blocks of specialized vocabulary were adopted from <a0_0>the languages of Western Europe<a0_0/>. By <b5_0>1800<b5_0/>, <b8_0>a significant portion<b8_0/> of the gentry spoke <a1_0>French<a1_0/> daily, and <a2_0>German<a2_0/> sometimes. Many Russian novels of the 19th century, e.g. <a3_0>Leo Tolstoy<a3_0/>'s (Лев Толсто́й) <b6_0><b9_0>War and Peace<b9_0/><b6_0/>, contain entire paragraphs and even pages in <a4_0>French<a4_0/> with no translation given, with an assumption that educated readers would not need one.
